embeds.title: Signature Finisher
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Champ / Downfall

Upon pickup, choose a Finisher. This Finisher costs 0, can be used without a **Stance**, and never causes your **Stance** to be exited.
*And now, it's time for my ULTIMATE MOVE!*

messages.content: <moment of truth>

embeds.title: Moment of Truth
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

**Retain**.
Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
:finisher:   **Finisher**

messages.content: Such a good relic
Never a time i'm disappointed to see it, even if it ends up targeting my Execute
because 0 cost giga twin strike with block and strength scaling is amazing

great with moment of truth as free draw and block with retain, great with Bring it On as free massive block and damage (counter), amazing with Rope-a-Dope imo, pretty much a Power from Beyond++ with Block
Also good with Crooked Strike bc it doest pull you out of stance, so you can use it and a combo/finisher for huge value
wait does it still give the finisher bonus even though you don't leave your stance>?
i would assume it's just like ultimate stance
im pretty sure yea
oh okay that's absolutely insane
it's rare for a reason!
It's a testament to how good it is when you can use it on extremely high cost cards for that energy save, but it's still extremely good with a 0 cost finisher
you can straight up ignore a decent part of the relic and it's still insanely good
its simply the best relic even if it wasnt champ exclusive
and that energy save alone would probably be pretty good
like "here make this card free lol"
technically no, no other characters have finishers.
but champ makes it "here make this card free and also give block and also circumvent the entire downside with finishers and also scale"
lol, you know what i mean tho
I like to compare it to <bottled anomaly> which has the 0 cost also

embeds.title: Bottled Anomaly
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / All / Downfall

Upon pickup, choose a card. At the start of each combat, remove it from your draw pile. At the start of turn 3, add it into your hand. It costs 0.
*Swirling and swirling and finally breaking.*

messages.content: better bottled anomaly tho
bc you can use it t1
the turn 3 part isn't really a huge downside, and that results in anomaly being an extremely good relic
which is MASSIVE
This is bottled anomaly but without that downside but with multiple upsides attached to it
it not being present t1 makes it enough of a downside that its not instagrab
even tho its instagrab 90% of the time
Honestly not really, it still saves so much energy in a run, and if you can duplicate the card the duplicated card still costs 0 but isn't removed from draw pile and can be drawn turn 1
Had a silent on downfall run where I Dolly's mirror'd a leg sweep and I got a 0 cost leg sweep turn 1 against time eater
well what i mean is like, if you use it on an expensive power like AI, a form, things like that
or a setup card like glacier
if it was able to be drawn t1 it would be borderline broken
No it would just be broken. Not borderline, that just is broken.
now give it an extremely beneficial way to straight up not even have to worry about the restrictions of a character's mechanics while still reaping the benefit and you have signature finisher
i consider the downside a positive in some cases like for a Reaper or One for All, where bottom drawing it is better than t1-2
pretty much
The only downside signature finisher has is that it only works on finishers, but still that is not nearly enough to balance it out.
if it was not restricted you could do some absolutely bonkers things
like Devestate, Masterful Slash, Death Blow
so ig its not as powerful as it maybe could be
but its still busted
isn't there an event that can make a card a finisher, or am I just imagining it?
wrong one
nope
those are the only ones i know that maybe could
nope

For what it's worth, I actually consider the delayed component of bottled anomaly to be an upside. There are quite a few cards that are not very good during the early turns of a fight, that are excellent in the middle/later turns of a fight. This is mostly true of cards that need certain things setup for them, like a card that wants tons of goop on an enemy, or lots of cards in your discard pile, high soulburn on an enemy, etc. Anything that gets better later on after you've done some scaling can be a great target for bottled anomaly. Alternatively, you can use it very effectively as cost reduction on certain big powers that are awkward to get in play (most of which are not good to draw on early turns during hallway fights at least), like most forms, stasis engine, etc.
Yeah bottled anomaly on a heat crush is beautiful
